text: This is the first time I've heard of a hacker being a better tester than the actual development team. 🤣
It's a sad day when even the hackers don't want your code. Maybe they should hire the hacker to fix the bugs! 😆
You know, I've heard of "ethical hacking," but this takes it to a whole new level. The hacker is like the Robin Hood of code quality.
Can we add "Hacker-Driven Development" to our list of software development methodologies now? 😂
I wonder how many bugs the hacker found before giving up and returning the code.
At least it shows that the hacker has some standards. Imagine the chaos if they released buggy code into the wild!
They probably saw the code and thought, "Nah, I'm not taking the blame for this mess." 😂
I feel like this is a reflection of the state of the industry. So many projects are rushed out the door with little concern for quality.
This is a good lesson for developers: if your code is so bad that even a hacker doesn't want it, you're doing something wrong. Time to level up those coding skills!
What's next? Hackers offering free code reviews? I'd be down for that.
